snippet: The advocate, Edwin Chota, and three other men were killed in a remote part of the Amazon jungle on their way to meet with leaders of another village in the region.
abstract: Authorities in Peru are investigating the killing of environmental advocate and indigenous leader Edwin Chota, who was killed along with three other men in a remote region of the Amazon jungle that he had sought to protect from illegal logging.

byline.original: By ANDREA ZARATE and WILLIAM NEUMAN
byline.contributor: Andrea Zarate reported from Lima, and William Neuman from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: The advocate, Edwin Chota, and three other men were killed in a remote part of the Amazon jungle on their way to meet with leaders of another village in the region.

headline.main: Peru Investigates the Killing of an Environmental Advocate
headline.print_headline: Peru Investigates the Killing of an Environmental Advocate
